intro: Hypoestes malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca hypostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble small flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is not commonly found in garden settings outside its native range.
